main event: On March 11, 1960, multiple witnesses observed a bright circular object moving slowly at high altitude in Waterbury, Connecticut.
interesting points: The object emitted no sound or trail and was observed for several minutes,The observation took place during daylight twilight,Request for further investigation was sent but not answered,The sighting involved a family who observed the object for approximately 5 minutes,Other children in the vicinity also reported seeing the same object with their parents.
sighted object: a bright circular object in the sky
witness description: a civilian family who observed the object
